description._content: Carmen McLeod has decided on a design for her table that is based on a series of small sculptures that she began in summer 2010. These intimate, simple sculptures invite prolonged, but casual viewing. Made from everyday materials such as found wood and painted foam, the sculptures are subtle examples of modest materials working together in unexpected yet unobtrusive ways to create a slightly different perspective on something generally familiar. On Wednesday evening, April 18, 2012, the Brooklyn Museum will host its annual fundraising gala, the Brooklyn Artists Ball. This year’s ball will celebrate women artists and recognize the fifth anniversary of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art. Guests will dine at table environments created for the occasion by sixteen Brooklyn women artists selected by the Museum’s curators. Each artist will transform a 40-foot-long table into a new work of art that will be on view for one night only. Brooklyn Artists Ball April 18, 2012 www.brooklynmuseum.org/calendar/event/5132
